result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:17 AM Defendant Jarrod W Coyle in court.  Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant states he is not eligible for Public Defender. He asks Court to appoint counsel.
Court advises him that he should fill out papers for court-appointed attorney. Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:47 AM Defendant Jarrod W Coyle not in court.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State requests warrant. Defendant has called and said he was going to be late.
Court orders warrant. No bond. Current cash bond may be forfeited.
10:59 Defendant now appears.
Kevin Hamill appears by video, is sworn and questioned by Attorney Knaapen.  He is a police officer with the Marshfield Police Department. On 8/25/22, he performed a traffic stop for a loud exhaust and expired registration. The driver was identified as the defendant. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom.  Officer Fox arrived at the scene with his canine who did a free air sniff of the vehicle and indicated on the vehicle. He states that there were glass pipes and glass vials with white substances and a backpack with white crystalline substance located in the vehicle. Rock crystalline substances were found on the defendant. All the substances tested positive for methamphetamine. Defendant was out on bond for felony and misdemeanor charges. Attorney Knaapen asks Court take judicial notice of 22CF431 and 22CF104, cases defendant was out on bond for.
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Court questions defendant regarding non-representation. He states he has not contacted public defender.
Court will set matter for arraignment and cancel warrant that was issued earlier. Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on October 10, 2022 at 10:45 am.

***Notice of hearing came back to Branch 3 on 10/5/22- Mailed notice to defendant on 10/5/22 (KC)***
1:56 PM Defendant Jarrod W Coyle appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney David R. Knaapen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failed to appear for his preliminary hearing.

3:18 PM Defendant Jarrod W Coyle not in court.  Attorney Austin Mogard in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State requests warrant.
Court orders warrant. No bond. Current cash bond may be forfeited.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on September 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:04 PM Defendant Jarrod W Coyle in court.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court cancels warrant. This matter will track with case # 22CF431.
Text Message Reminder of Court Date Agreement
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:19 AM Defendant Jarrod W Coyle not in court.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State requests warrant and cash bond be forfeited.
Court orders warrant. No bond. Cash bond may be forfeited.
Absolute sobriety. No controlled substances without a valid prescription. $500.
Absolute sobriety. No controlled substances without a valid prescription. 22-12366 $500
